intro: Echium triste, commonly known as the weedy evening primrose, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It is a herbaceous annual or biennial plant that typically grows up to 1 meter in height. The plant produces showy, tubular flowers that are usually pink or purple, which bloom in the late afternoon and night. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are hairy and often branched. Echium triste is adapted to dry, disturbed soils and is often found in fields, roadsides, and wastelands.
